paper_abstract: In this paper, an effective per-antenna successive signal-to-leakage-plus-noise-ratio (PA-SSLNR) based precoding is proposed for multi-user multiple-input multiple-output (MIMO) broadcast channel. The signal-to-leakage-plus-noise-ratio (SLNR) of per-antenna is calculated only using the unknown leakages and the known leakages are cancelled at the transmit side by Tomlinson-Harashima Precoding (THP). The proposed scheme is different from per-user SSLNR. It does not need QR decomposition. The proposed precoding scheme is further improved by ordering antennas. Simulation results show that the proposed schemes exhibit a considerable bit error rate (BER) improvement over conventional SLNR scheme.
paper_title: Effective Per-Antenna SSLNR Precoding for MIMO Broadcast Channel
